snippet: This year the archdiocese has ordained only one priest, the Rev. Patric D’Arcy, the first time that has happened in more than 115 years.
abstract: Number of Roman Catholic seminarians has been declining, in New York and nationally, since the 1960s; this year, the Archdiocese of New York has ordained only one new priest, Rev Patric D’Arcy; it is the first time that a single priest was ordained since the archdiocese opened its seminary more than 110 years ago.
lead_paragraph: This year the archdiocese has ordained only one priest, the Rev. Patric D’Arcy, the first time that has happened in more than 115 years.

headline.seo: Patric D’Arcy Is N.Y. Archdiocese’s Only New Priest
headline.main: For New York Archdiocese’s One New Priest, a Lonely Distinction
headline.print_headline: For One New Priest, a Lonely Distinction
